newsitem.title: USA: Zenith National acquires workers' comp plan.
newsitem.headline: Zenith National acquires workers' comp plan.

text.p: Zenith National Insurance Corp. said late Tuesday its Zenith Insurance Co. unit will acquire all the assets and workers' compensation insurance business of Riscorp Inc. for at least $35 million in cash.

Zenith, which specialises in workers' compensation insurance, also will acquire Riscorp's existing insurance business, the right to new and renewal policies, and its managed care workers' compensation system.
After the deal closes, Riscorp will no longer engage in the workers' compensation or managed care businesses.
In a statement, Zenith said it would pay the difference between the book value of purchased assets and the book value of assumed liabilities.
Zenith said it will fund the deal with bank financing and internal funds.
It said it will not acquire the stock of Riscorp or its affiliates or assume their corporate liabilities.
Zenith, based in Woodland Hills, Calif., had about $200 million in premiums written in 1996. It operates in 26 states, mainly California, Florida and Texas.
